bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 12 (Friday, January 19, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. CLARKE of New York:H.R. 4856.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:the power granted to Congress under Article I of the UnitedStates Constitution and its subsequent amendments, andfurther clarified and interpreted by the Supreme Court of theUnited States[Page H583]

item.latestTitle: A bill to direct the Joint Committee on the Library to obtain a statue of Shirley Chisholm for placement in the United States Capitol.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

This bill requires the Joint Committee on the Library to enter into an agreement to obtain a statue of Shirley Chisholm.

The committee may authorize the Architect of the Capitol to enter into the agreement as well as related contracts.

The committee shall place the statue in a suitable permanent location in the U.S. Capitol.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: To direct the Joint Committee on the Library to obtain a statue of Shirley Chisholm for placement in the United States Capitol.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
